Sequence Information.Function: Chitin-binding protein with a defensive function against numerous chitin containing fungal pathogens. It is also a potent inhibitor of Gram-positive bacteria.

Literature.Title: Cloning and characterization of a cDNA encoding an antimicrobial chitin-binding protein from amaranth, Amaranthus caudatus.
Literature.Author: Cammue B.P.A.,Vanderleyden J.,Rees S.B.,David K.M.M.,de Bolle M.F.C.

Literature.Title: Antimicrobial peptides from Amaranthus caudatus seeds with sequence homology to the cysteine/glycine-rich domain of chitin-binding proteins.
Literature.Author: Proost P.,de Bolle M.F.C.,Terras F.R.G.,Marien W.,Broekaert W.F.

Literature.Title: H NMR study of the solution structure of Ac-AMP2, a sugar binding antimicrobial protein isolated from Amaranthus caudatus.
Literature.Author: Wyns L.,Pepermans H.A.M.,Loris R.,Maes D.,Martins J.C.

Literature.Title: Location of the three disulfide bonds in an antimicrobial peptide from Amaranthus caudatus using mass spectrometry.
Literature.Author: Tourwe D.,Wyns L.,Verheyden P.,Laus G.,el Boiyoussfi M.
